se.cbb.jprime.math

Class IntegerInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.math.IntegerInterval

  • public class IntegerInterval
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a 1-D integer valued interval of the type [a,b], (-inf,inf), etc. Negative and positive infinity are represented by Integer.MIN_VALUE and Integer.MAX_VALUE respectively.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntegerInterval

        public IntegerInterval(int a,
               int b)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        a - lower bound. Integer.MIN_VALUE is interpreted as negative infinity.
        b - upper bound. Integer.MAX_VALUE is interpreted as positive infinity.

      • IntegerInterval

        public IntegerInterval()
        Constructor. Creates an unbounded interval.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of elements of this interval, e.g. 3 for [0,2] or infinity for [7,inf].
        Returns:
        the number of elements of the interval.

      • getType

        public IntegerInterval.Type getType()
        Returns the boundary type of this interval.
        Returns:
        the boundary type.

      • isWithin

        public boolean isWithin(int value)
        Returns true if a specified value is within the interval.
        Parameters:
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        true if within; false if outside.

      • getRandom

        public int getRandom(java.util.Random rng)
        Returns a random int uniformly drawn from this interval.
        Parameters:
        rng - a (possibly pseudo) random number generator.
        Returns:
        a random int drawn using rng.
